info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 20 at 5:24PM MDT until July 20 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM MDT FOR NORTHEASTERN ARAPAHOE...SOUTHWESTERN WASHINGTON AND SOUTHEASTERN ADAMS COUNTIES... At 524 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles southwest of Shamrock, or 34 miles south of Fort Morgan, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Cottonwood Valley and Last Chance. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
